Dialogue.NPCText:
The magistrate’s sharp eyes flick over you, his black robes immaculate, fingers stained with ink and secrets.

"Citizen, you stand before the law of Sunreach. Speak quickly—justice waits for no one, and neither does the Council. What is your business with the court?"

Option.text: I wish to serve Sunreach. Any work for a loyal subject?
Rumor has it justice is for sale here...
I come seeking the truth about the city’s corruption.
What does the magistrate truly fear?
Who is Elric Thornwall, really?
Just passing through, magistrate.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thornwall leans forward, voice low.

"There is a matter requiring discretion and loyalty—not to the Council, but to Sunreach’s future.

A foul cult lurks beneath our streets, loyal to a distant queen whose name is best left unspoken. Their blood rites endanger our peace—and, I confess, my reputation. The Council cannot know how deep their rot has spread.

If you would serve the city...root them out. Return with proof, and the law will reward you handsomely."

Option.text: Where do I begin this investigation?
Is the Council itself not corrupted?
What is my reward for this service?
On second thought, I am not interested.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He hands you a crumpled writ.

"Begin in the undercity—the sewers beneath the southern docks. Seek the cult’s symbol: a red-stained hand. Bring me a token from their altar, and keep your tongue. The Council need not hear of this."

(You have received the Writ of the Shadow Judge.)

Option.text: I’ll return with proof—and silence.
Any advice for surviving the cult’s wrath?
If I find your name among the cultists’ ledgers?
I need more time to prepare.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He fixes you with a cold stare.
"Trust no one below. The cult’s eyes are everywhere—even among the guard. If you are caught, you never met me. Remember: evidence, not bodies, is the coin I seek."

Option.text: Understood. I’ll keep my wits.
Your secrets are safe. For a price.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Go now. Return with a <BASEFONT COLOR='#e04646'>Blood Cult Relic</BASEFONT> from their altar, and Sunreach’s shadows will favor you."

Option.text: I will see it done.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Thornwall smiles thinly.
"Gold, certainly. But more—my signature buys freedom in Sunreach, for the right hands. Do this, and I’ll write your name in the ledgers of the innocent. That is a gift worth far more than coin."

Option.text: I accept the task.
I demand gold up front.
On second thought, I’ll pass.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The magistrate’s expression never wavers.
"Every law has its price, citizen. Speak plainly: are you here to buy justice, or to sell secrets?"

Option.text: How much to overlook a pirate friend’s crime?
What’s it worth to keep your own name off a cult ledger?
Never mind.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He taps his desk impatiently.
"Names. Sums. I have a ledger for both."

Option.text: [Pay 2,500 gold] Free a pirate from custody.
Option.action: GoldAtLeast:2500|GiveGold:-2500|SendMessage:The magistrate nods and signs a discreet order.

Option.text: On second thought, I’ll handle it myself.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He slips the coin into his sleeve.
"Done. This conversation never happened. Don’t test my patience."

Option.text: Your discretion is appreciated.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His hand freezes, then clenches.
"What do you know? Speak carefully, friend—there are ears even here. If you bring me evidence, I can be...generous. Or are you simply making threats?"

Option.text: Bring proof of the magistrate’s cult ties.
Just testing your nerves.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The magistrate pales, sweat on his brow.
"You play a dangerous game. Name your price, and forget what you saw—or share it, and Sunreach’s shadows will swallow you too."

Option.text: [Extort 5,000 gold] My silence isn’t cheap.
Option.action: GoldAtLeast:0|GiveGold:5000|SendMessage:The magistrate empties a coffer in desperation.

Option.text: Threaten to expose him to the Council.
Walk away, satisfied with his fear.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He hisses, voice trembling.
"Expose me, and you doom us both. The Council does not tolerate weakness—or witnesses. Be wise, friend."

Option.text: Perhaps we can work together instead.
You’re right. No one needs to know.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The magistrate’s gaze hardens.
"Truth is a blade with no hilt. Seek it, and you risk bleeding for others’ crimes. What truth do you pursue: the Council’s dealings, the blood cult’s secrets, or my own sins?"

Option.text: Tell me of the Council’s corruption.
Who truly commands the blood cult?
What skeletons hide in your closet, Elric?
Perhaps I should seek truth elsewhere.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He sighs, voice dropping to a whisper.
"Five Houses, five vultures. Darius Veynar buys loyalty; Lady Seraphine sells it. I walk a line between them all, but even the strongest rope frays. Serve the city, not the Council. That is all I ask."

Option.text: Then help me bring down the blood cult.
Sounds like you could use an ally.
I’ll be going now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The magistrate’s face blanches at the name.
"Speak not of her! The cult’s high priestess answers only to Minax herself. She walks the sewers at midnight, whispering promises of immortality to fools. Root them out, and Sunreach may yet stand."

Option.text: I’ll find and destroy the cult’s relics.
I want nothing to do with this darkness.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A rare moment of vulnerability slips through.
"Fear? I have watched men hang for lesser secrets than mine. I fear only the day my power fails...or when she learns the truth I have tried so hard to bury."

Option.text: Who is 'she'?
I will keep your secrets—if you help me.
Enough of this. I’m leaving.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His hand trembles on the desk.
"Aria Silverhand is...different. Her eyes see through lies, even mine. If you cross her, tread carefully. If you aid her, perhaps you can do what I never could—redeem this city."

Option.text: Thank you for your candor. Let’s discuss work.
I’ll seek Aria’s counsel, then.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He waves a hand dismissively.
"Then move along. Justice is busy, and mercy is in short supply."

Option.text: Very well, magistrate.
On second thought, I have business with you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Elric folds his hands, his voice quieter than before.

"Few ask that question. Fewer survive the answer. But perhaps... you're not like the others. You wish to know who I was, or what I became?"

Option.text: Tell me about your past.
What drives a magistrate to such... shadows?
Who do you trust in this city?
I’ve heard whispers of your feelings for Aria Silverhand.
I’ve heard whispers of your feelings for Aria Silverhand.
Let’s speak of something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He exhales slowly.

"I was once a clerk of the Court of Britain. Idealistic. Naïve. I thought the law was a sword to protect the weak. Then the Gem shattered, and Minax’s shadow fell. One by one, laws bent, people broke, and I... adapted."
"Sunreach offered me power. And power demands silence more than it does justice."

Option.text: You sound bitter.
What changed you most?

Dialogue.NPCText:
His voice lowers to a whisper.

"My predecessor was poisoned for refusing a Council bribe. I inherited the robes before his corpse was cold. I remember standing over his desk, wondering if I would die the same way.

Now? I fear I won't die at all—not until I’ve betrayed everyone I once cared for."

Option.text: You still have choices left, Elric.
The law is just a tool to you, isn’t it?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Elric's gaze sharpens.

"Justice is a lie told to the poor to keep them docile. I maintain order because chaos invites Minax. That’s my truth."

"But even lies have their uses, and law—bent though it is—still offers a shield for those clever enough to stand beneath it."

Option.text: And what do you stand beneath?
I understand more than you think.
That sounds like cowardice wrapped in legalese.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He hesitates.

"I trust very little. But Aria... she's different. Too honest to survive long here. Too smart not to see through me."

"She’s seen what I’ve become—and still she hasn’t exposed me. Not yet."

Option.text: Do you love her?
You’re afraid she’ll turn on you.
Let’s move on.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Elric stiffens, then slowly nods.

"Aria... yes. I’ve loved her from the first moment she defied the Council in open court. But love and power do not mix. If she knew what I’ve done..."
His voice falters for a moment. "Tell no one. Please."

Option.text: Your secret is safe. For now.
Perhaps I’ll speak with Aria about it.
Option.action: SendMessage:You feel his panic before he masks it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Elric gives a mirthless chuckle.

"So even the court’s whispers have reached your ears. Yes... Aria. Her mind is sharper than any blade, her courage foolishly noble. She is the only light left in this place. And I am the shadow she cannot see."
"Speak to her, if you must—but if she learns the truth of me, I fear what it will cost."

Option.text: I understand. I’ll keep your confidence.
She deserves to know.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He closes his eyes.

"What does it matter? I cannot protect her from this place, and she will never love the man I’ve become."
"Still... if anything happens to me, promise me you’ll warn her. She must leave Sunreach before it consumes her too."

Option.text: I promise.
I can’t promise anything.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A tremor passes through his hand.

"Every day I wake expecting a dagger or a summons. She knows enough to destroy me. But she doesn’t. I don’t know why."
"Maybe... maybe some part of her still believes there’s a man worth saving behind this mask."

Option.text: Then give her a reason to keep believing.
You’re past saving, Thornwall.
